New Records: Seth Lugo tied Atlanta ace Chris Sale and Detroit lefty Tarik Skubal for most wins in the majors with 16 victories
Key Match Events: Seth Lugo struck out 10 in seven masterful innings
Salvador Perez hit two run-scoring singles to reach 100 RBIs for the second time
Tommy Pham homered and Bobby Witt Jr. had an RBI single for the Royals
Lugo retired 17 straight batters after Gleyber Torres' bloop hit to begin the bottom of the first
Pre-Game Insights: The Royals were looking to even the series after a tough loss the previous day
Lugo mentioned that the atmosphere in New York is what the Royals will face in the playoffs
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone said that Lugo's performance was probably as good as there's been against the Yankees this year
Lugo said that he was locating all of his pitches and didn't think there was a pitch that he didn't think he could throw where he wanted
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Royals remained 3 1/2 games behind first-place Cleveland in the AL Central
The Yankees' advantage in the AL East was shaved to a half-game over second-place Baltimore
The Royals hold a 2 1/2-game edge over Minnesota for the league's second wild card
Others: Michael Lorenzen (left hamstring strain) was tagged for three runs and five hits over 1 2/3 innings during a rehab start with Double-A Northwest Arkansas
LHP Will Smith (back spasms) planned to throw another bullpen at less than full intensity
DJ LeMahieu (right hip impingement) might return this season, but it's not a guarantee
